description.narrative: Job creation: The new facility is expected to create about 150 new jobs as well as additional jobs in line with the facilitys growth and expansion in the coming years; Support for the Indian wind power market: by producing low-cost turbines locally that are best suited to the countrys grid and wind conditions, the Gamesa Project will help develop and bolster the wind market in India; Technology transfer: while the Project currently envisions assembly in India, the Company aims to have a full turbine production facility set up in the long-term. This process will result in the transfer of important climate change related technology.

The proposed project is to provide debt financing of up to 11 million to Gamesa Wind Turbines (GWT or the Company), a wind turbine assembly facility in India (the Project). The turbines assembled at this facility will be exported, sold domestically as well as used in local wind farms developed by the Company. Spain-based Gamesa Corporación Tecnológica S.A. (Gamesa or the Sponsor), which is one of the three largest wind turbine manufacturers globally, established GWT in late 2009 to lay the groundwork for producing wind turbines in India. The GWT facility is located in Chennai and will produce cost effective wind turbines specially suited for the Indian grid and wind conditions. GWT is also involved with conducting research on developing sites appropriate for wind farms in the region and has, to date, signed contracts in India and Sri Lanka for the installation of more than 60 MW. The facility has a capacity of 200 MW per annum and the Company has plans to scale it to over 800 MW in the coming two years through the new wind turbine assembly facility.
